events.name: 3D scanning and printing Meetup
events.description: Wondering how to get started on your 3D printing? Maybe you have started on a 3D model and making your first 3D printed products, but you haven't got a clue how to make money from it? Hear from our guest artists who will share with you their practical tips and experiences! Join us for a few hours of 3D printing and scanning over some finger food too. Sign up early - we can only take about 20 people. See you folks!
events.location: Hackerspace, 344B King George's Avenue, Singapore

events.name: FPV Racing & Fun
events.description: Location: The park is in the corner between Tanjong Rhu View and Rhu Cross, just north of the ECP flyover. There are a few trees and a bit of open space, very good for proximity flying and racing practice. It's about a 10 minute walk from Stadium MRT if you are travelling by public transport, and there is a carpark nearby if you're coming by car. If you have difficulty finding us then contact me by whatsapp/sms: +6591001743 This event will be focusing mostly on 250 Class FPV Racers, and will be great for people looking to hone their flying skills, meet other racers, or just to learn about FPV Racing and how to go about building a fast, agile, FPV Racer. N.B. These meetups are not a commercial venture and all participants participate at their own risk and liability.
events.location: Rhu Cross, Rhu Cross, Singapore

events.name: Ethereum Pub Crawl / Social event
events.description: On Saturday, join us get to meet the community who are interested in blockchain technology and knock back a few drinks together. Ethereum's devs will be gracing this event. This will be an informal gathering of blockchain and tech enthusiasts to network, hangout, ask questions and of course have fun. Looking forward to seeing as many people there! No age limit (just be above 18)! Location TBD, or if anyone has a good spot to recommend please pm me. See you there! This event is an informal meet up and is not sponsored.
events.location: Level 33, 8 Marina Blvd 33-01 Marina Bay Financial Tower, Singapore

events.name: The role of CIO in leading transformation
events.description: Case study of a semi-conductor packaging industry. Dealing with MERGER & ACQUISITIONS. Managing Technology TRANSFORMATION. Learning how value of such transformation can be COMMUNICATED EFFECTIVELY.  Managing expectations from various stakeholders
events.location: Lifelong Learning Institute, , 11 EUNOS ROAD 8, Singapore 408601

events.name: Book Club: High Performance Browser Networking
events.description: We're going to be working through this highly-regarded book by Google engineer, Ilya Grigorik: High Performance Browser Networking: What Every Web Developer Should Know about Networking and Web Performance This week we'll be covering Chapter 5 & 6: Introduction to Wireless Networks & WiFi. Please read the chapter before you come to the meetup! Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong Rd Singapore 437032 Singapore Doors open at 6:30, meetup starts at 7. Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore

events.name: Ruby Meetup, RDRC Edition
events.description: Hi everyone! This month we're pushing our regular meetup back to coincide with RDRC and catch up with our international friends in town for Ruby week! If you're in town for the conference, or just in town, come join us for pizza/talks: Date: Tuesday, the 2nd of June, 7.00pm Venue: IDA Labs Level 2 @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, #02-04, 188969, Singapore We're always looking for new speakers, and we'd especially love to hear from folks who are visiting Singapore that week! Ping us (Anna or Winston) if you'd like to do a 10-15min talk or 5 Random Ruby Tips (details below). See you there! -------------- 1. "Ruby MetaProgramming" - Song Yangyu 2. "Mid Life Bliss: Switching careers to software development" - Jason Z. 3. 5 Random Ruby Tips - Juanito Fatas Huang * Hot Picks - This is a 5-10 minute session during which anyone can stand up and say something interesting! -------------- Would you like to speak at our future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack, your new RubyGem, or your opinions on best practices, so that people can get to know how awesome you are! We also have a 5min section on "5 Random Ruby Tips" that you can volunteer for - I am sure you must have came across some interesting Ruby nuggets in the last month right? So don't be shy! Step forward and share your knowledge! Ping Winston @winstonyw or winstonyw@gmail.com, or Anna @anna_fil or annafil@gmail.com. See you all soon! -------------- Job Postings -------------- Are you looking for Rubyists? Do you have a job posting? Email us a blurb (< 50 words) + link and we'll put it here. -------------- Thank You, Sponsors! Food and Drinks: Venue:
events.location: IDA Labs Level 2 @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, #02-04, Singapore 188969

events.name: June Meetup: Java 8... and Mister Paul Maritz!!!
events.description: First talk: Paul Maritz (starting at 7PM) Paul Maritz is the CEO of Pivotal. He is well known in the industry as a great leader and a visionary. At the beginning of his career, he spent 14 years at Microsoft and became part of the MS Executive committee. After that, he did some philanthropy work in Africa and became the highly respected CEO of VMware [masked]). During Paul’s time at VMware, the virtualization giant purchased 2 startup companies: SpringSource and Cloud Foundry. In 2013, SpringSource and Cloud Foundry have been moved to a new spin-off company called Pivotal Inc. Paul now is the CEO of Pivotal. He is the leader that we all dream to have. We are thrilled to have Paul speak at the Singapore Spring User Group. We will only have 30 minutes of his time so please be on time! Second talk: Java 8 Frans Effendi and Puneet Dewan (both work at PayPal) will discuss about the cool Java 8 features that you should be using. Java 8 was released in March last year. This release is packed with some really exciting features. In this session, they will go over: 1.Lambda expressions 2. Streams 3.New Date and Time API. Come and let’s explore how Java 8 enhances our productivity! Also, please be aware that we will be in Suntec.
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: Meteor June Meetup
events.description: Hello everyone, It's time for our June MeteorSG meetup! This is kind of a placeholder for now as some people are starting to ask when the next meetup is :-) *** Call for speakers! Message us on our facebook page (link below) or comment below if you have anything interesting to present! *** Doors open from 7pm and we will start the talks promptly at 7.30pm. ==================================== Meetup Agenda: #1 - EJSON - Duncan Foster #2 - A Trio of Useful Packages : autoform, simple-schema and collection2 - Dan Tran An overview of a very widely used suite of Meteor packages from community developer 'aldeed': https://github.com/aldeed #3 - PayPal Express Checkout with Meteor - Albert Tirtohadi #4 - Show & Tell: - Package for Meteor Scaffolding - Tze Ken Le e #5 - Meteor Clinic: - We are going to try something new - if anyone has any specific Meteor questions or problems they can ask the community here to see if someone can help. So please make a note of any questions/problems you have! Remember - there is no such thing as a 'stupid question' ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/No_such_thing_as_a_stupid_question ) #6 Housekeeping - Reminder that we have the following communication channels: Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/meteorjssg Slack: https://meteorsg.slack.com Website & Blog: http://singapore.meteor.com/ #7 Socializing / Networking ==================================== We do also try to allocate some time for anyone to share about any Meteor projects they are working on or would like to talk about. We should have a projector at the venue so please just bring a laptop if you would like to do this. Some talks may be interactive so if you wish to follow along then please bring along a laptop (preferably with Meteor and MongoDB pre-installed). Location: Nitrous.IO office Remember to bring photo ID to get through building security. Organizers : Tze Ken Lee , Cofounder & Director at InnoMonster Pte. Ltd. 5 years of experience in web development. Rick Behl, Old school programmer, hacker and entrepreneur
events.location: Nitrous.IO, 1 Trengganu St, 2nd Floor, Singapore 058455

events.name: Start You own E-Business Right Now with Millionaire's help
events.description: Thinking of starting a thriving internet business from scratch but have absolutely no idea, no time, have little or no cash? Ask the speaker, Winston - like Zuckerberg's friend Dustin and Eduardo "Never hesitated when good business opportunity came his way." Over the last years, he managed to achieve his million dollar dream, four times over: 1. Top achiever in ERA in his first month of business, generating over 80 millions real estate deals in just one year 2. Started a training company generating more than a million a year 3. Ventured into high-end boutique and expanded to 7 outlets across Singapore 4. Set up an e-commerce business, his latest venture, generating US$12m sales last year You wanna meet this guy? Easy ! Register below , then you are free to attend this workshop, he will share all his experience to make such big success ! Face-To-Face ! Register Link: http://goo.gl/forms/UhbGOw8ZQK Activity Outline: - Five steps to build a successful e-commerce business - How to apply the Law of resonance to business - How to spot real money-making opportunities online - How do Apple and Google capture our daily searches to find out the next money-spinning business. - Why 99% e-commerce business online have little or no sales. - How to convert a satisfied customer into bringing even more businesses to you - Introduce a disruptive technology - Live demonstration on how to 'unlock' your brain to see opportunities before you - Learn to setup a own personal website in multiple languages, complete with order, payment, sales tracking system etc. - How to use free internet ad like Facebook, Craigslist etc. to advertise your products -How to generation of traffic to your website using social media like Facebook, Hangout Air etc. -Identify the common mistakes and pitfalls using social media - and much more.... *As this is likely to be a full house seminar and to ensure you are not denied entry, please Register use the link below: Register Link: http://goo.gl/forms/UhbGOw8ZQK
events.location: Bugis , 452 North Bridge Road, #04-00 Chan Brothers Building, Singapore 188733

events.name: June/2015 - Open Space (Stories)
events.description: Open Space Theme: Stories We, humans learn best from stories. Bring stories of your successes or failures and tell them to each other. Use stories to share your knowledge and experience. Put your questions in context by telling a story and asking others to tell their stories of a similar situation in response. Agenda 7:00pm - Networking and pizza 7:30pm - Topic generation 8:00pm - Breakout sessions 10:00pm - End We welcome contributions of drinks and snacks! =) What is Open Space? Open Space is a highly collaborative and self-organised meeting where topics are generated on the spot and discussed by the participants through breakout sessions. For more information read Open Space Technology . Getting There Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2 is just right above of Downtown station along Downtown Line (DT) .
events.location: Barclays, 10 Marina Boulevard, #23-01, Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2, Singapore

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: One Thursday a month, 7pm to 10pm [EVENT IS NOW FULL*] Chicks on Speed: The Art of Work Part 2 In collaboration with Malvina Tan, Dinu Bodiciu, Lennat Mak and Zul Mahmod Enjoy a drink at the bar from 7pm. Doors open at 8.15pm. Performance at 8.30pm Expression Gallery, Level 4 *Please note that you need to have registered via Eventbrite to get a ticket for entry to the performance. The allocation for this performance has now been fully used up and there are no further tickets available. Please ensure you have the print-out or soft copy confirmation with you on the night. Globetrotting performance, art, music, and new media collective Chicks on Speed take the stage this ArtScience Late with their special mix of irony and electronic beats. Merging video, choreography and fashion, they will be playing live against the backdrop of their surrealistic and poetic short films. Be prepared for an evening that will be visually stunning as well as sonically explosive. In partnership with NTU CCA Residencies Programme.
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: HIKVISION CCTV Training (Singapore) -  June 2015 (Products/VMS)
events.description:
Hikvision Singapore Pte Ltd, has introduced classroom learning to help dealers and installers get up to speed on Hikvision video products. 
Three training modules catered to pre-sales and technical, which are available free to Hikvision customers, let them spend some time in Hikvision Singapore office to learn about the features built into the company’s cameras, DVRs and software. 
  
Agenda for this Training: 
2:30pm - 3:00pm Register/ Tea and Get-Know Session 
3:00pm-3:30pm   Introduction of Hikvision and range of Network Cameras by Hikvision (New) 
3:30-4pm)            Tea Break 
4:30pm- 6pm        Practical : ivms 4200/4500 Hands-On: "Adding Cameras and Finding your way in ivms 4200"  Product Demo iVMS 5200 
  
Hikvision is the world's largest supplier of video surveillance products and solutions. The company specializes in video surveillance technology, as well as designing and manufacturing a full-line of innovative CCTV and video surveillance products. The product line ranges from cameras and DVRs to video management software. Since its inception in 2001, Hikvision has quickly achieved a leading worldwide market position in the security industry. 
Hikvision possess the world's largest R&D team and state-of-art manufacturing facilities; both allow Hikvision’s customers the benefit of world-class products that are designed with cutting-edge technology. As further commitment to its customers, Hikvision annually reinvests 7% of its revenue into R&D for continued product innovation and improvement.
Hikvision operates over 30 domestic branches in China and 16 overseas regional subsidiaries all over the world to achieve a truly global presence. Hikvision is now publicly listed on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange.
Hikvision customers who wish to register their interest in taking advantage of the training modules or to find out more can do so by emailing: ryan.tan@hikvision.com or call 90027441.
events.location: HIKVISION SINGAPORE PTE LTD OFFICE, , 18 Sin Ming Ln,#08-07, MIDVIEW CITY, Singapore 573960

events.name: Code for Fun, Code for All
events.description: The “Code for Fun, Code for All” event is being co-organised with MOE CPDD to promote awareness and interest in computing. Attendees to this event have the opportunity to try different aspects of computing, including: - Scratch programming - Computer control of hardware and sensing - Basic sorting algorithms The event will run at two locations, with two different activities: - Scientist for a Day gallery: Hour of Code style stations, where attendees can freely walk in to an available station to try coding - Digital Design Studio: Workshop style activity on Scratch programming Interested participants can walk in, no registration required. *Do note that there is no admission charge for Singaporeans and PR. Kindly produce your NRIC when you enter. Standard rate applies to overseas visitors and all other residents
events.location: Science Centre Singapore

events.name: How to create a working & fluid prototype in 12 days - A Pop-up design studio case study by @Wang Xiaodan
events.description: This is a case study on how to set up pop up design studios to gain real time user feedback and rapidly improve it. The client who commissioned this product design project is an international Hotel chain. Our team at Thoughtworks worked on the redesign of their hotel booking process. Within 12 days, we did an inception workshop with extended stakeholders from the client side, provided interaction and visual design mockups, a fluid working prototype (smart phones/tablets/desktop), and conducted user testings in various hotel lobbies as well as 1-1 in depth user testings. Xiaodan joined Thoughtworks in 2012 as the lead user experience designer, She has 15 years experience in the online space, covering areas from interaction design to product strategy, design management to user research. Prior to Singapore, she worked at Yahoo! & Microsoft based in London. Outside of design, she is an artist by training, an urban gardener, a freelance writer and photographer. NOTE: Lunch for attendees will be sponsored by Thoughtworks
events.location: Plug-In@Blk71

events.name: Hebocon Singapore (Robotics competition for the technically ungifted)
events.description: We will be holding a HEBOCON challenge as part of the South East Asia Makerspace Summit scheduled to be held from 5-7 June 2015. Known as Japan’s "worst robot competition”, the purpose of the HEBOCON event is to find out which crappy robot is the ultimate failure of them all through a sumo-styled wrestling battle. This event will serve as a testbed for the organizers to improve the competition processes leading to the HEBOCON main event in July. Thank you. For more information about HEBOCON, check out the official page at https://www.facebook.com/Hebocon.Official
events.location: OneMaker Group - OMG

events.name: Fridays with Family
events.description: A collection of innovative and highly interactive activities for families to explore and discover together! Explore family engineering and spending quality family time together, encouraging a child to Imagine, Create and Discover!
events.location: Science Centre Singapore

events.name: Get Kanban Workshop
events.description: Most awaited and unique Agile coaching & training workshop in town is LIVE now, Register now RSVP, Limited to 26 attendees The getKanban Board Game is a physical board game designed to teach the concepts and mechanics of Kanban for software development in a workshop setting. It has been described as the most effective way to teach Kanban. It’s hands-on, engaging, and fun.During the workshop the teams construct charts based on data from the game including a Cumulative Flow Diagram, and a Statistical Process Control Chart. Play and Learn Kanban About Maris Maris has 16 years of IT experience as Servant Leader, providing fiscal, strategic &operational leadership in uniquely challenging situations .He orchestrate as Agile Change Agent primarily in the role of Agile Coach and Enterprise agile Transformer.Maris has had extensive experience in architecting agile process solutions using the flavours of Scrum, XP, Kanban and Lean operational waste reduction and implemented in various types of projects. He specializes in XP engineering practices including pair-programming, TDD, ATDD, BDD and continuous integration. He holds Engineering Degree in Electrical and Post graduate in Software systems from BITS and Senior Management from IIM Calcutta. He holds CSM, CSP, PMI-ACP, SAFePC, PMP, PRINCE 2, ITIL, PMOC, TOGAF9, DAD-YB, and SCEA. How to reach, Step by step instructions: http://bit.ly/1bqTbB4
events.location: 261, Waterloo Street,#04-35, Waterloo Centre, Singapore 180261, 261, Waterloo Street,#04-35, Waterloo Centre, Singapore 180261

events.name: Rails Girls Meetup (RDRC Edition)
events.description: Southeast Asia’s largest Ruby conference, Red Dot Ruby Conference, is back! Rails Girls Singapore is joining forces with RDRC to bring you this special edition of Rails Girls. How special, you ask? We will be inviting Linda Liukas, the founder of Rails Girls, coming to speak to us all the way from Helsinki, Finland! Linda is the author and illustrator of Hello Ruby, a childrens picture book about the whimsical world of computers, as well as the founder of Rails Girls, a global movement to teach young women programming in over 220 cities. She loves Muji, Zelda Fitzgerald, software and sparkly things. On top of that, you will also hear a special talk by Vaidehi Joshi. She is formerly a teacher, sometimes a writer, and currently a web developer at Friends of The Web in Baltimore, Maryland. Vaidehi is a graduate of the Flatiron School and a big time cheesecake enthusiast. Join us in learning Rails on 6th June! Light snacks will be provided. Agenda : 09:30 - 09:45 Registration 09:45 - 10:00 Introduction + Break into Groups 10:00 - 10:15 Address by Linda Liukas 10:15 - 11:30 Code 11:30 - 11:45 Break 11:45 - 12:00 Experience of Flatiron School by Vaidehi Joshi 12:00 - 13:15 Code 13:15 - 13:30 Closeup ---------- FAQs ---------- I haven't attended any previous Rails Girls events. Can I still join in this one? Absolutely! We can help you start with the Rails Girls app if you did not attend the last workshop. What should I bring? A working laptop and power supply. Is this free? Yes! Can I come if I'm not a woman? Rails Girls is designed for women and anyone who self-identifies as a woman. Men are most welcomed as a participant's +1 . Is there an age limit? Nope! Event is full! What should I do? Join the waitlist! We'll let you know when a new slot becomes available. Also, please update your RVSP if your plans have changed. Someone will really appreciate your slot. :) I'm a professional Rails Developer, can I be a coach? Yes, we are always looking for Ruby/Rails experts to help! Please drop us an email at elisha@learnemy.com or stania@thoughtworks.com and DO NOT RSVP to this event. Confirmed coaches: - Michael - Garima - Sheng Loong - Lachlan - Steven Yap - Jack Chen Can my company sponsor Rails Girls meetup? Thank you for helping us build an awesome community! If your company would like to sponsor this meetup, please get in touch with Elisha (elisha@learnemy.com) and Tania (stania@thoughtworks.com).
events.location: IDA Labs Level 3 @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, #03-04, 188969, Singapore

events.name: ETSY Craft Party 2015 SINGAPORE
events.description:
Etsy is a marketplace where people around the world connect, both online and offline, make, sell and buy unique goods. Since 2010, Etsy has hosted Etsy Craft Party, a global celebration of meeting and making.  
This is the 3rd party in Singapore and we would like to invite you to come and celebrate this big day with us. Consider it like a Handmade Craft Holiday! 
This year's theme is Kaleidoscope: Paper Taking Shape. We will explore and make a few crafts with paper. How many pieces of papers form a picture? Let's create a variety of collage and paper cutting techniques. One of the crafts we'll be making is paper weaving. Combine your favorite images with embellishments like ribbon, yarn, colored paper, magazine pages, or even your child’s artwork, and you’ll have a one-of-a-kind statement piece to display in your home. 
ETSY CRAFT PARTY 
6 June 2015 
Time: 2-6pm 
Place: The Playtent  
Sign up today to find out what other fun crafts we will be making on the 6th! 
https://www.etsy.com/local/craftparty/event/23279223368/etsy-craft-party-2015-singapore-june-6 
BUT secure your seat through payment on this Eventbrite page. We can only take in those who have RSVP-ed and make payment. 
Add us on FB or instagram @simply4love and join our FB Group here 
https://www.facebook.com/groups/etsycraftivistsg/ 
For any questions, please email us at simply4love@ymail.com or whatapp 8298 4274 or 9067 0847. 
See you soon! 
#craftparty @etsy
events.location: The Playtent, , 180 Joo Chiat Road #02-01, Singapore 427451

events.name: GitHub PatchWork Singapore
events.description: Please RSVP at https://grumpygits.github.io/2015/06/06/github-patchwork-singapore.html We're also looking for mentors! If you use GitHub regularly and would love to share your knowledge of it, sign up at the same link above! -- Learning open source, together. Patchwork is a hands on workshop for learning Git and GitHub. There will be snacks for hackin', lots to learn, and new friends to be made. We'll have GitHubbers and other open source contributors as mentors to lend a hand as attendees make their way through the workshop.
events.location: National Design Centre

(He said something about being humbled by it.) Speaker: Robert Sim​ 3) Why use Symfony 2? Speaker: Laurent Ghirardotti -------------------------------------- Lightning Talks: Application Performance Management for PHP Understand how you can use APM to throughout the lifecycle of your PHP application (development, UAT, operation, new releases) Speaker: Eric Tan, AppDynamics *** Call for lightning talks *** Do message me or email me at [masked]. (Subject: "I want to speak!") Venue / Food Sponsor: PayPal Singapore

events.name: Bluemix for IT SME (Small and Medium Enterprises) and Startups
events.description: IBM Bluemix is a Platform-as-a-Service (Paas) that supports several programming languages and services as well as integrated DevOps to build, run, deploy and manage applications on the cloud. It will be a hands-on workshop to learn about building apps on Bluemix. Participants will get an opportunity to deploy their application and have it running in a matter of hours. This session will cover the following: - Intro by IBM - Fundamentals of Bluemix - Building Mobile app - Chat app and Sales Chart app in no time - Register and hands-on with Bluemix *Bring your own laptop Register here for your Bluemix account.

events.description: Hackware is a monthly meetup for hardware developers and enthusiasts to share hacks and developments in the hardware scene, promote hardware development and to build a community of hardware developers. Agenda & Talks for this meetup: 1. Intro to BLE Part 2 - BLE programming on iOS, Raspberry Pi and demoing the use of a BLE sniffer - Yeo Kheng Meng 2. TBC 3. TBC We need speakers and demos! Let us know if you have something!
events.location: HackerspaceSG

events.name: Women in Tech: Innovation with Cloud
events.description: Want to find out more about cloud and mobile, or get better at it? Come join us for a night learning to compose in Bluemix & hear from a panel of leading ladies in STEM on innovations in the cloud. Join us over dinner to meet great folks and take a step towards bigger things!
events.location: JFDI.ASIA @ Blk 71, , 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #05-16, SINGAPORE 139951

events.name: Haskell Meetup in June
events.description: Here comes Haskell Meetup in June. This month we have three talks. # Talks * Open Problems in Cross Compilation using Haskell on ARM (iOS), by Moritz * hpack: An alternative format for Haskell packages, by Simon * A tutorial on Damas Hindley Milner type system, by Paul * getopt-generics, by Sönke Hahn [ http://hackage.haskell.org/package/getopt-generics ] # Speakers, in lexical order Moritz Angermann: http://www.lichtzwerge.de Paul Meng: http://paulme.ng Sönke Hahn: https://github.com/soenkehahn Simon Hengel: http://typeful.net

events.name: PUGs Meetup June-2015
events.description: We are now a strong groups of 100 Postgresites! And some of us have come after an expereince with proprietary database e.g. Oracle, SQL Server. And Wei-Shan is one of them. \m/ Join us as he will share his own story of this transformation from being an Oracle DBA to a PostgreSQL DBA. Meanwhile the commitfest for v9.5 was recently concluded and there are some really exciting tihngs coming to PostgreSQL v9.5. Let's discuss them briefly. So there is a lot Postgres to be discussed! Come join and bring your friends and colleagues...
events.location: Hackerspace, 344B King George's Building, Singapore

events.name: Making With Light
events.description: Its the International Year of Light! Light plays a vital role in our daily lives and is an imperative cross-cutting discipline of science in the 21st century. It has revolutionized medicine and opened up international communication. Come join us and tinker with Light
events.location: Science Centre Singapore

events.name: Front End TL;DR June 2015
events.description: ReferralCandy is where we'll meet up. Come see what their front end engineering team is doing, and spend an evening learning the latest front end technology. Address: Block 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #06-26, Singapore 139951 FEDS is about hands-on, collaborative learning. Join the session if you'd like to learn new front end technology. Schedule: Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time. 7:00pm — Arrival, registration, seating 7:10pm — Intro talk 7:30pm — Teams work on mini challenges 8:30pm — Presentations, awards 9:00pm — The end. More info: http://feds.strikingly.com/ PS: Bring a laptop and show up a bit earlier to get set up on the wifi.

events.name: Papers We Love SG #010
events.description: Paper #1 - The Derivative of a Regular Type is its Type of One-Hole Contexts : Érdi Gergő - http://strictlypositive.org/diff.pdf Paper #2 - A Protocol for Packet Network Intercommunication: Sayanee Basu - http://www.cs.princeton.edu/courses/archive/fall06/cos561/papers/cerf74.pdf ------------------- What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved? What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss. ----------------- Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

events.name: Clean & Green Pre-Hackathon Workshop 2015
events.description:
CLEAN & GREEN HACKATHON 2015 
 The Clean & Green Hackathon 2015 (19 to 21 June) is a big step towards cultivating a collective environmental consciousness amongst those of us who call Singapore home. It's an exciting opportunity to apply your expertise and help us become a more active and gracious society, one that respects the environment and takes care of our public spaces.   
The Clean & Green Pre-Hackathon Workshop gives you the chance to gain deeper insights into the hackathon themes and apply them when designing appropriate programmes or applications that address these issues at the hackathon.   

  
Workshop Programme 
Drawing on design thinking principles, the workshop is designed to help you see the problems in new light and from other people's perspectives.    
• Introduction to the hackathon challenges: 1) Reducing Littering and 2) Reducing and Recycling Waste  
• Expert sharing on the topics, including current challenges and future opportunities  
• Hands-on group ideation exercise - share observations, participate in discussion, develop / record insights, ideation and sharing   
Date: Tuesday, 16 June 2015 
Time: 6.30pm - 9.00pm 
Venue: TBC 
  
More Info 
Find out more about the hackathon here. If you've got any questions feel free to get in touch with the hackathon organisers at  hello@upsingapore.com.

events.name: Sunday Showcase
events.description: Sunday Showcase allows visitors unique access to cutting edge projects being undertaken by different tertiary institutions across Singapore. events.name: National Cloud Computing Distinguished Speaker Series - Brian Mathews
events.description:
Capture, Compute, Create: How cloud technology is changing design 
  
Abstract 
The impulse to design is universal, but the tools for changing our world have been limited. Recent cloud technologies are disrupting how professionals design, how non-professionals participate, and how new tools may solve the world’s toughest challenges. This presentation explores the cloud technology trends that are combining to revolutionize the future of making things: Reality Capture, Cloud Data, Infinite Computing, Computational Physics, and 3D Creation. 
  
Biodata 
As Vice President and Platform Group CTO, Brian Mathews helps shape the technology strategy for Autodesk’s platforms and products serving the design, engineering, and construction industries.  He also heads the Reality Computing and Sustainability Solutions business units.  Reality computing involves sensor techniques such as 3D laser scanning, augmented reality, photogrammetry, computer vision, and reverse engineering to model the world.  Previously, he was VP of Autodesk Labs, a hub connecting design professionals with innovative technologies.  He held Software Architecture and Engineering Management positions for collaboration solutions, data publishing, and the graphics technology used in several products including AutoCAD. Prior to Autodesk, he was the Chief Architect at Buzzsaw.com, the leading cloud collaboration tool for the construction industry, and held technical positions at Sun Microsystems and Ithaca Software. Mathews earned his Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees in Electrical Engineering from Cornell University. He was the original creator of the DWF format and holds a variety of patents.
events.location: Genexis Theatre, , Fusionopolis, 1 Fusionopolis Way, Fusionopolis (Connexis Tower), Singapore 138632

events.name: ISS Seminar - Online Collaboration: Fact or Fiction?
events.description:
Online Collaboration is the child of Knowledge Management and the Internet, a new paradigm of professional cooperation in organisations made possible by the social capabilities of the web. It is also the open secret to solving the productivity problems entrenched in many companies stuck in the world of emails and silos. Implementing and adopting online collaboration is, however, easier said than done.  
In this seminar, you will hear: 

State of online collaboration in Singapore
Overview of selected online collaboration tools
The importance of culture and adoption

 Who Should Attend Social Media Folks: professionals in the business of dealing with social, digital, marketing, branding, content, development and strategy, especially internal social. If you’re keen to find out what’s going to be relevant and beneficial to your business and life in the fast-paced world of social, this seminar is for you.  
For detailed agenda, visit https://www.iss.nus.edu.sg/Events/ISSSeminars/OnlineCollaborationFactorFiction.aspx 
  
  
Please note that this site is not developed nor maintained by the Institute of Systems Science at the National University of Singapore (NUS-ISS).  This is a third party independent site subject to its own data protection and privacy practices and you are encouraged to examine them before proceeding to share your personal data.  NUS-ISS will collect, use and/or disclose the personal data submitted through this third party independent site for the purpose of administration and/or management of the event.
events.location: Institute of Systems Science, NUS, , 25 Heng Mui Keng Terrace, Singapore 119615

events.name: BayesiaLab Workshop: Artificial Intelligence for Research, Analytics, and Reasoning
events.description:
In fields ranging from bioinformatics to marketing science, Bayesian networks have revolutionized the way scientists explore high-dimensional problem domains. And, since the first release of the BayesiaLab software package in 2001, practitioners have been able to leverage this powerful paradigm for their research without having to write a single line of code. 
Learn what the Bayesian networks revolution is all about, and join Stefan Conrady and Dr. Lionel Jouffe for a complimentary workshop on knowledge discovery with Bayesian networks and BayesiaLab. In the presentation, we will first lay out the basics of the Bayesian network formalism and then illustrate a practical application in a live software demo. 
Target Audience: 
Applied researchers, statisticians, data scientists, data miners, biologists, biostatisticians, epidemiologists, predictive modelers, econometricians, economists, engineers, market researchers, knowledge managers, marketing scientists, social scientists, students and teachers in related fields.
events.location: Matrix @ Biopolis, , 30 Biopolis St, Level 4, Singapore 138671

events.description:
CENSAM Annual Workshop 2014 
















CENSAM Annual Workshop 2014







View this email in your browser











 









 


ANNUAL WORKSHOP 2014







 








  
25 JUNE 2014    ERC AUDITORIUM  NUS UTOWN,  CREATE  



GET DIRECTIONS














  
CENSAM 7th Annual Workshop  







Invitation from Organisers    The Center for Environmental Sensing and Modeling (CENSAM) is pleased to invite you to its 7th Annual Workshop. In designing this year's programme, we have aimed at balancing scientific interest, diversity and accessibility for a broad audience. A number of CENSAM researchers and collaborators will present short talks, providing a flavour of the diverse interdisciplinary research being conducted at CENSAM. 
We are pleased to announce that Mr Choi Shing Kwok (Permanent Secretary, Ministry of the Environment and Water Resources) and Prof Peter J. Edwards (Director, Singapore-ETH Centre, SEC) will present keynote talks and will be available for Q&A. In addition, we have set aside significant time for poster sessions, providing space for interaction over refreshments. 
We look forward to welcoming you at CENSAM's 7th Annual Workshop. Please click the register button below and do not hesitate to contact us if you require further information/assistance.    (Feel free to forward this invitation to colleagues who might be interested in attending our workshop) 








 







REGISTER HERE

events.name: 2-Day Short Course: Bayesian Networks & BayesiaLab 101
events.description:
Two-Day Short Course: Bayesian Networks & BayesiaLab 101 in Singapore 
"Currently, Bayesian Networks have become one of the most complete, self-sustained and coherent formalisms used for knowledge acquisition, representation and application through computer systems." (Bouhamed et al., 2015) 
Join this course to learn about the principles of Bayesian networks and how to apply them for research and analytics with the BayesiaLab software platform. You will see that Bayesian networks are ideally suited to model a wide range of high-dimensional problem domains. Overall, this course's focus in on leveraging Bayesian networks for applied research, with the objective of solving problems that currently appear difficult or intractable with traditional statistical methods. 
This "short course" is a compact version of the highly acclaimed 3-Day Introductory BayesiaLab Course, which we have been offering around the world for almost ten years. We have designed this new 2-day course for scientists who are interested in utilizing Bayesian networks for their research, but for whom the current 3-day program might be too much of a time commitment. 
Throughout this course, we exclusively use the BayesiaLab software platform. Therefore, you have access to a full license of BayesiaLab Professional for a 30-day period starting on the first day of the course. This gives you the opportunity to replicate all examples from the course at your leisure on your own computer. 
 
Date and Location 
July 2-3, 2015 9:00am-5:00pm (both days) 
Singapore Management University School of Accountancy 60 Stamford Road Seminar Room 2.5 Singapore 178899 
Overview 
Day 1 

Introductory Examples of Probabilistic Reasoning:
Prosecutor's Fallacy
Simpson's Paradox
Bayes' Rule and the Bayesian Network Formalism
Graph Structures, d-Separation
Encoding Bayesian Networks from Domain Knowledge
Omnidirectional Inference for Diagnosis and Simulation
Observation versus Intervention/Causation

Day 2 

Prerequisites for Machine-Learning Bayesian Networks:
Information Theory, incl. Entropy, Mutual Information, Minimum Description Length
Unsupervised Structural Learning for Knowledge Discovery
Supervised Learning for Predictive Modeling, Feature Selection
Variable Clustering
Data Clustering
Latent Factor Inductions and Probabilistic Structural Equation Models
Network Analysis and Simulation
Using Bayesian Networks for Decision Support

What's required?  

Working knowledge of specifying and estimating linear models.
No prior knowledge of Bayesian networks or Bayesian statistics is required.
No programming skills are required. You will use the graphical user interface of BayesiaLab for all exercises in class.

Who should attend?  
Bioinformaticians, biostatisticians, clinical scientists, computer scientists, data scientists, decision scientists, demographers, ecologists, econometricians, economists, epidemiologists, knowledge managers, management scientists, market researchers, marketing scientists, operations research analysts, policy analysts, predictive modelers, research investigators, risk managers, social scientists, statisticians, plus students and teachers of related fields. 
Two-Day Short Course: Bayesian Networks & BayesiaLab 101 in Singapore
events.location: Singapore Management University, School of Accountancy, , 60 Stamford Road, Seminar Room 2.5, Singapore 178899

events.name: Singapore Microbiome Networking Symposium
events.description:
Singapore Microbiome Networking Symposium  
NUS Centre for Life Sciences, Auditorium 
Monday, 28th July 2015 
Time: 09:00-16:00  

  
Sponsored by Department of Biochemistry (National University of Singapore, NUS) and American Society of Microbiology (ASM), Singapore Micriobiome Networking Symposium aims to promote scientific exchanges and collaborations in the field of Microbiome Research. 
This year, with the support of Singapore Society for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology (SSBMB), Singapore Society for Microbiology and Biotechnology (SSMB), Department of Microbiology (NUS), and NUS Synthetic Biology for Clinical and Technological Innovation (SynCTI), the symposium will be held in NUS Centre for Life Sciences Auditorium. Invited speakers will be sharing developments and new insights on the human microbiome. 
We warmly invite graduate students, postdoctoral fellows, fellow biologists and researchers to attend this special event. Come join us and find out the latest developments in microbiome research! 
  
PS: Please select the ticket type "Expression of Interest Talk" to indicate that you wish to present in this networking symposium (Duration: 5 min).  
  
Organising committee: 
A/P Gan Yunn Hwen (Chair) 
A/P Yew Wen Shan 
A/P Thilo Hagen 
A/P Lee Yuan Kun 
Dr Ratha Mahendran 
  
 FAQs  
1. Where is the event held? 
The event will be held at the Auditorium located at the first floor of CeLS. 
The full address is as follows: 
  
National University of Singapore 
Centre for Life Sciences 
28 Medical Drive 
Singapore 117456 
  
  
2. What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
Arriving by public transport (Bus) 

Take bus service 95 at bus-stop along MOE building.
Service 95 will turn into the National University Hospital (NUH).
Alight at the 1st bus stop.
You should see a gentle slope up towards Medical Drive. Walk up Medical Drive until you reach the Centre for Life Sciences (CeLS) building on your right.     

Arriving by public transport (MRT) 

If you’re not on Circle Line, take the MRT to Buona Vista.
Make that switch to Circle Line to Kent Ridge Station.
Alight at Kent Ridge Station.
Walk towards Kopitiam Foodcourt towards the other end of National University Hospital (NUH) main building. You should then see a gentle slope up towards Medical Drive. Walk up Medical Drive until you reach the Centre for Life Sciences (CeLS) building on your right.    

Arriving by private transport/taxi 

Take a taxi or private vehicle to the Ayer Rajah Expressway (AYE).
Turn off at the South Buona Vista/NUH (National University Hospital) exit.
Head towards NUH (don’t turn into NUH) and go straight until you see Medical Drive. Turn left into Medical Drive and stop outside the Centre for Life Sciences (CeLS) building.
Private vehicles can park in the public carparks located in NUH Medical Centre or at the open air carpark atFaculty of Science, opposite Faculty of Dentistry.    

Science Carpark 
Operating Hours: 0830 to 1930 
Parking Rates: $0.0214 per minute (maximum charge of $1.284 for vehicles entering from 6pm to 7.30pm on weekdays) 
NUH Medical Centre 
Operating Hours: 0000 to 2359 
Parking Rates: $0.035 per minute
events.location: Centre for Life Sciences, , 28 Medical Drive, National University of Singapore, Singapore 117456

events.name: Hackware v0.x

events.location: Hackerspace.SG, 344B King George's Ave, King George's Building, Singapore

events.name: A look at Ways To Monetize Your 3D Printing Hobby
events.description: Wondering how to get started on your 3D printing? Maybe you have started on a 3D model and making your first 3D printed products, but you haven't got a clue how to make money from it? Hear from our guest artists who will share with you their practical tips and experiences! Join us for a few hours of 3D printing and scanning over some finger food too. Sign up early - we can only take about 20 people. See you folks!
events.location: Hackerspace, 344B King George's Avenue, Singapore

events.name: PowerShell Forum
events.description: Full details soon! This is a 2 full day event with International Speakers as a build up to the PowerShell Summit 2016. It's the first event of its kind in Asia. This will have a nominal entrance fee (to help cover the huge costs) but there will be great intermediate and advanced content by MVPs and world recognised Experts. Registration will be via a different channel and will open nearer the time but we want to make sure this is in our User Groups schedule on Meet Up also.
